page.title: 01BARROW-UPON-HUMBER
page.content: The village is in the midst of an agricultural region and is located 1 mile from the River Humber.In earlier times St.Chad built a "house" (no trace today) nearby and John Harrison (inventor of the ships chronometer) lived here. The decline over the last 10 years, of the local industry has brought its associated problems in terms of employment; many women work on the land during the agricultural seasons, whilst the men travel to the industrial sites of Killingholme. The village has become more residential in character although very little is provided in terms of entertainment and public transport. The Barclay Survey (1978) saw the development of a Linear Town of which Barrow would have played no small part, but the Humber Bridge Toll and the estimated decline in the birth rate, have delayed this.
